answers.author: Amanda Dodge
answers.text:
Hi Ronald, 
I have been able to locate some documents that I think will help to answer your question. 
In Aiken, South Carolina’s 2009 Zoning Ordinance, their sign section seems particularly relevant. Although they do not reference electronic signs and off-premise signs together, it still provides the ordinances for each. In the pdf, the section on signs can be found on pages 90-100, with page 91 about off-site signs and page 100 about electronic signs:
http://bit.ly/fc2QVP
Also, the 2008 Zoning Ordinance from Killeen, Texas also makes reference to off-premise electronic signs and goes on to set limits for the intensity of the lights. This information is located on pages 82-84 of the pdf:
http://bit.ly/eSdWhx
Additionally, the Village of La Grange, Illinois created a specific sign code. They list general standards for electronic signs on pages 4-5 and off-premise signs on page 9:
http://bit.ly/gOYS9J
Finally, I was able to find the Houston, Texas Sign Code. This document seemed to be the most useful and clear in terms of answering your question. The relevant pages in the pdf are 67-70.
http://bit.ly/gaVB3H
Even though some of these documents only give information on off-site signs and electronic signs separately, I hope this at least points you in the right direction.
Amanda Dodge
International City/County Management Association
Knowledge Network Intern
202-962-3699
adodge@icma.org
